us.title: S&P 500: Prepare For More Hits. Week Starting 24th March (Technical Analysis)
us.content: The S&P 500's recent rally appears to be a bear market bounce, with significant resistance at 5750-75 likely capping any short-term gains. March typically ends weak and further declines are expected, similar to the 2022 correction pattern.

us.title: Crypto Stocks Crash Amid Bitcoin and Altcoin Market Crash
us.content: Crypto stock market crash happened as Bitcoin's decline drags the market down. Mining firms like Marathon Digital and Riot Blockchain are facing steep losses.

us.title: Wall Street Week Ahead
us.content: Wall Street has plenty to look forward to next week, including a busy economic calendar that will culminate in a key inflation reading. There is also a massive initial public offering on deck.

us.title: The Markets And The Uncertainty Principle
us.content: In our country's current state, there are so many current uncertainties that are hard to measure and even harder still to apply to our equity and bond markets. Fear is part of the reason, in my estimation, that the markets have declined.

us.title: Are Stocks Bottoming? Investor Sentiment vs Investing Reality
us.content: The S&P 500 Index (INDEXSP:.INX) and financial markets are trying to climb a wall of worry this week. While sentiment indicators flash red, real-time data on consumer spending, labor markets, and credit conditions suggest a much more stable macro environment.

us.title: Top producer of primary aluminum unveils how Trump tariffs will benefit US manufacturing
us.content: Century Aluminum CEO Jesse Gary breaks down the national and economic impact from President Trump's tariff policies, how it affects his business and the building of a new smelter. #foxbusiness #manufacturing #trump #tariffs #smelting #aluminium

us.title: Fed Watch: Let's Just Wait and See
us.content: By Kevin Flanagan, Head of Fixed Income Strategy Key Takeaways The Federal Reserve kept rates unchanged for the second consecutive FOMC meeting, signaling a cautious “wait and see” approach amid economic uncertainty and Washington policy concerns.

us.title: Will 'Drill, Baby, Drill' Work for the US Economy?
us.content: Bloomberg's Alix Steel talks to oil producers and policymakers at CERA week. Saad Rahim of Trafigura and Harold Hamm of Continental Resources tell us why an industry that wanted to pump more oil into the market is now having second thoughts.

us.title: Investors Who Were All In on U.S. Stocks Are Starting to Look Elsewhere
us.content: American exceptionalism was this year's big trade. Now some are hedging their bets.

us.title: Apple's Product Roadmap Reportedly Includes Camera-Equipped Watch
us.content: Apple is reportedly working on a new version of its Watch that includes a camera. As Bloomberg News reported Sunday (March 23), the camera would help the watch see the outside world and use artificial intelligence (AI) to provide relevant information.

us.title: Solana has become a breeding ground for pump and dump memecoin ‘cabals': Bloomberg
us.content: The memecoin craze that started off two years ago on the Solana blockchain appeared to be organic. However, since then, the blockchain has drawn high-profile individuals, including U.S. President Donald Trump and his wife, Melania Trump, as well as Argentina President Javier Milei.

us.title: ARNC INVESTOR ALERT: Bronstein, Gewirtz & Grossman LLC Announces that Arconic Corporation Investors with Substantial Losses Have Opportunity to Lead Class Action Lawsuit
us.content: NEW YORK, March 23, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Attorney Advertising -- Bronstein, Gewirtz & Grossman, LLC, a nationally recognized law firm, notifies investors that a class action lawsuit has been filed against Arconic Corporation (“Arconic” or “the Company”) (NYSE: ARNC) and certain of its officers. Class Definition This lawsuit seeks to recover damages against Defendants for alleged violations of the federal securities laws on behalf of all persons and entities that purchased or otherwise acquired Arconic securities between April 19, 2022 and May 3, 2023, both dates inclusive (the “Class Period”).

france.title: S&P 500 Ends Losing Streak Amid Trade and Fed Uncertainty
france.content:
The S&P 500 snapped a four-week losing streak with a marginal gain on Friday, but market volatility remained elevated as investors navigated trade policy uncertainty and a Federal Reserve policy update.

At the close:

  • Dow Jones Industrial Average: +31 points (+0.1%)

  • S&P 500 Index: +0.04%

  • NASDAQ Composite: +0.5%

Key Market Drivers

1. Trump Signals Flexibility on Reciprocal Tariffs

President Donald Trump said Friday that his administration would show “flexibility” on reciprocal tariffs, which are set to take effect on April 2.

This follows weeks of uncertainty over U.S. trade policy, with shifting rhetoric from the White House causing investor unease. The decision by the European Union (EU) to delay retaliatory tariffs on U.S. whiskey has raised hopes that diplomatic talks may ease tensions between Washington and Brussels.

However, ongoing tariff uncertainty leaves markets vulnerable to further volatility.

2. Mixed Signals from the Federal Reserve

The Federal Reserve left interest rates unchanged this week, as widely expected. However, its updated economic projections sent mixed signals:
✅ Maintained expectations of 50 basis points in rate cuts this year
❌ Raised inflation forecasts, which could limit the Fed’s ability to cut rates

The Fed’s uncertainty over the inflationary impact of tariffs adds another layer of complexity to its decision-making. With inflation projected to stay above 2%, traders remain skeptical about how aggressively the Fed will ease policy in 2025.

3. FedEx Stock Plunges on Profit Warning

FedEx (NYSE:FDX) dropped over 6% after cutting its annual profit and revenue forecast. The company cited:

  • Weak U.S. industrial activity

  • Lower-than-expected demand for its services

FedEx’s warning highlights broader economic uncertainty and slowing corporate earnings growth, reinforcing concerns about the resilience of the U.S. economy.

Market Outlook: Monitoring Key Indicators

To track the market’s response to trade and Fed policy, investors should watch technical indicators such as:
📉 Relative Strength Index (RSI): Identifying overbought/oversold conditions
📊 Moving Averages (50-day & 200-day): Gauging market trends
📈 Volatility Index (VIX): Measuring investor sentiment

For real-time market data, leverage FMP APIs:
✅ S&P 500 Historical Data API (Track index trends & price movements)
✅ Economic Calendar API (Stay updated on key economic events like Fed decisions & tariffs)

Final Thoughts

Despite snapping a losing streak, the S&P 500 remains in a fragile state, with trade uncertainties and Fed policy shifts keeping investors on edge. With April 2 tariff deadlines and earnings season approaching, volatility is likely to persist.

Key Watchpoints for Next Week:

🔹 Fed officials’ speeches & inflation data
🔹 Updates on U.S.-EU trade negotiations
🔹 Corporate earnings guidance (especially in the industrial & tech sectors)

france.title: The bull market isn't over yet: Why the market correction is actually a buying opportunity
france.content: Despite worries about the impact of US President Donald Trump's tariff policies and concerns about the healing of the economy fueling market volatility (^DJI, ^IXIC, ^GSPC), EVERCORE ISI senior managing director of equity, derivatives, and quantitative strategy Julian Emanuel says the bull market has room to run, and downturns are buying opportunities. france.title: The Stock Market Faces An Economic Reality Check
france.content: Earnings for 2025 are declining, leading to lower expected growth rates and increased vulnerability for the S&P 500, potentially exceeding a 10% decline. Historical trends indicate that the S&P 500 is significantly overvalued, with current PE ratios not justified by lower earnings growth rates.

france.title: Ways to Leverage Inverse ETFs, Commodities Until "Overdue" Market Rally
france.content: Chris Vermeulen is bearish on mega and small caps until there's clear indicators the markets will rally off current levels. He urges investors to look into inverse ETFs as a way to play on bearish action.

france.title: Time To Buy Ethereum? Here's What This Analyst Thinks
france.content: Ethereum (ETH) registered some minor gains in the past week, rising by 2.80%. Nevertheless, the prominent altcoin remains far from breaking out of a downtrend stretching as far back as December.

france.title: Bitcoin Futures Data Shows Bullish Long/Short Ratio – Details
france.content: Bitcoin continues to trade within a tight range, consolidating below the $85,000 mark and holding above the $81,000 support zone. Bulls are making efforts to reclaim higher levels and spark a recovery rally, but persistent macroeconomic uncertainty and growing concerns over global trade tensions continue to weigh on market sentiment.

france.title: Japan's Open House to accept DOGE, SOL and XRP for real estate amid friendlier regulatory climate
france.content: The Open House Group, a prominent Tokyo Stock Exchange-listed real estate firm, has expanded its crypto payment options to include XRP, SOL, and DOGE. This addition brings the total number of accepted digital currencies on the company's platform to five, complementing the previously supported Bitcoin (BTC) and Ethereum (ETH).
